title: Akali's Crescent Slash No Longer Procs Mark of the Assassin.
body:
A missing change on Surrender at 20 and Reign of Gaming, since Crescent Slash's tooltip wasn't updated.

So Akali a big nerf this patch 5.2.

Edit: 
Surrender at 20 now updated with Akali's Crescent Slash change, and it is intended.
http://www.surrenderat20.net/2015/01/120-pbe-update.html#comment-1805637260

**"Moobeat went and checked with Scarizard about it:"**
> " For the moment, it's intended. I can ping designers tomorrow for context, but it's listed in our notes."

Actually you should when going in for a kill. Generally, Akali's will throw their Q at the intended target, wait until Q is almost done with the CD, ult in auto, Q and then E. Its much quicker than trying to use 2 autos to proc 2 Qs.
true but you can't really do that anymore :c

Imaging an Akali vs. Darius, Renekton, Riven, etc. when Akali have to autoattack them to do some damage.

But there is anyother big, big nerf that akali mains will see. The double proc is the strongest thing about akali. The enemy has the Q on him: You go R autoattack Q and E. The combo is much slower now and this alone will make such a big difference... And yes, there is the R change...

Well, it turns out assassins are supposed to be countered by people who build defenses early in lane, denying them kills (such as bruisers and tanks), this holds true for ALL assassins, with the exception of Zed and Akali, who had enough damage to burst people through their defenses. This is bad, and so, while this nerf might be a bit too much, the fact that you can no longer go Akali top and burst down a Darius or Renekton, is actually a good thing, this was never a thing you were meant to do. Keep in mind, Akali top is still viable, since she can burst them ranged toplaner squishies like Quinn, Jayce and so on.

Because that's why Akali has counterplay issues against melees, Crescent Slash makes proccing MoTA so trivial against them, especially double-marking. 

It was either reduce MoTA duration, which is a big-no, because that would mean double-marking won't be available anymore, or make proccing MoTA harder, i.e. takes more risk, therefore more skill to pull off --> removing Crescent Slash.

Honestly, Season 1 Akali mains will be the ones that are not QQing, mostly the bandwagoners that played Akali after her passive requirements were removed, because timing and AA'ing is too hard for them.
She needs a complete rework

Akali no longer has an E ability pretty much

It is still a useful wave clearing tool, so Akali still has an E ability. Though it just doesn't have synergy with the rest of her kit.

And in a fight it might be worth it to not use it to conserve energy to use W and Q more (and it does actually cost quite a bit of energy)

E for wave clear. W so that the enemy has to buy pink ward or trinket. Whats left? Oh, a Q with about 35 start damage that only can be procced with an AA (more damage from the enemy or even running into deadly combo (riven)). The R is left with 100 less range. You will never reach the ADC in a high elo TF fight. And IF you get to him, you will never get an autoattack on him which a good support on him. We dont have to talk about double proc anymore...

Just remove akali instead of crippling her like that...

I'm not sure, since I'm not an Akali player, but many champions land an AA instantly when they gapclose onto an enemy (this is particularly clear with Diana and Xin Zhao, since they have very visible AA procs and targeted gapclosers) so this might be the case for Akali, or it might be getting coded this way. It's a shame to see double procs go, since that was the difference between good Akalis and GREAT Akalis, and the range nerf is a terrible, terrible thing (if you don't think 100 range is a lot, that's the difference between a Caitlyn auto and a Draven auto) but it WOULD be survivable with some compensation buffs.
